question: Halal Food and other questions..
answer:
QUESTION
as-salaam-ailikum 1. Are you allowed to eat French Fries, Cofee, Fish, ice cream etc. from an American managed and own place as long as there is not any non-halal item in there?? OR Does these items also has to be from a place own by Muslim. Only managed/employee working there or also own by Muslim? 2. As u said that one should recite durood 500 times a day, does it matter which durood one should read... i knoe this shortest dursood called 'Sallallaahu Alayhi Wasallam' and then i knoe the other durood that isn't as short as this one so is it okie to read the short one or is it better to read the longer one?? thank you for the answers. May Allah bless you and your family!
ANSWER


Share:
1. We are ordered to exercise extreme precaution in the consumption of
Halaal and abstaining from Haraam. Fish is Halaal and so too is milk, but we
have heard of non-Muslim food outlets spinkling alcohol in sea-foods and
ice-ream for flavouring.
If the non-Muslim outlet is managed by a Muslim who has sound knowledge of
Halaal and Haraam and is upright and sensitive to matters of Deen, then one
may trust his advise in the non-Muslim outlet under his management. He
should not be a person who and wishes to advance the course of the company
at the expenses of compromising in Halaal and Haraam.
2. You may recite the Durood mentioned by you.

and Allah Ta'ala Knows Best

Mufti Ebrahim Desai
